sense.name: put to death
sense.commentary: Note: Usage applies to both legal and non-legal (but planned) killing.
sense.examples: He was executed for murder. He is the first first federal prisoner to be executed in 38 years. My dad's cousin was executed by the mafia for collaborating with the police.

sense.name: do, put into effect, or carry out terms or intent
sense.commentary: Note: -LAW: carry out terms laid out in a will, legal document, or legal decision -COMPUTER: run a computer file or program in response to a command or instruction
sense.examples: We will see the deal executed as planned. The whole play was executed with great precision. The court revoked probation and executed a sentence of 12 months' incarceration. For most states, you must be age 18 or older to execute a will. I executed a program I had written many times and got valid output. The skater executed 11 most difficult jumps currently being done. The whole play was executed with great precision.

sense.name: sign a legal document before witnesses
